1063.question: What is the performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present?
1063.response: {'Answer': 'The performance of the textual semantic similarity task decreases as the percentage of error increases. When there is no error, the performance is highest. As the percentage of error increases, the performance decreases. For IMDB and SST-2 datasets, the F1 score decreases. For STS-B dataset, the Pearson-Spearman correlation decreases.'}
1063.answer:
10 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  60 points when error increase by 20%
50 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  55 points when error increase by 20%

1064.question: Which sentiment analysis data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced?
1064.response: {'Answer': 'SST-B dataset has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced.'}
